post.description: Utility tool for 'AI Optimization Keyword Data Locations and Languages' (ai_opt_kw_data_loc_and_lang) to get list of availible locations and languages
Utility tool for 'AI Optimization LLM Mentions Locations and Languages' (ai_opt_llm_ment_loc_and_lang) to get list of available locations and languages
This endpoint provides aggregated LLM mentions metrics grouped by the most frequently mentioned pages for the specified target

domain.description: Target domain to search for LLM mentions

search_filter.description: Search filter to apply (include or exclude)

search_scope.description: Target search scope for LLM mentions

keyword.description: Target keyword to search for LLM mentions

search_filter.description: Search filter to apply (include or exclude)

search_scope.description: Target search scope for LLM mentions

target.description: Array of target objects to search for LLM mentions. Each object must contain either 'domain' or 'keyword'. Maximum number of targets: 1000

location_name.description: full name of the location, example: 'United Kingdom', 'United States'

platform.description: Platform to search for LLM mentions

filters.description:
you can add several filters at once (8 filters maximum)
   you should set a logical operator and, or between the conditions
   the following operators are supported:
   regex, not_regex, <, <=, >, >=, =, <>, in, not_in, match, not_match, ilike, not_ilike, like, not_like
   you can use the % operator with like and not_like, as well as ilike and not_ilike to match any string of zero or more characters
   merge operator must be a string and connect two other arrays, availible values: or, and.
   example:
["ai_search_volume",">","1000"]
The full list of possible filters is available in 'ai_optimization_llm_mentions_filters' tool

order_by.description:
resuresults sorting rules
optional field
you can use the same values as in the filters array to sort the results
possible sorting types:
asc – results will be sorted in the ascending order
desc – results will be sorted in the descending order
you should use a comma to set up a sorting type
example:
["ai_search_volume,desc"]
note that you can set no more than three sorting rules in a single request
you should use a comma to separate several sorting rules
example:
["ai_search_volume,desc"]
The full list of possible orders is available in 'ai_optimization_llm_mentions_filters' tool

limit.description: Number of results to return. Default is 10, maximum is 1000.

post.description: This endpoint provides aggregated metrics for mentions of the keywords or domains specified in the target array of the request.

search_filter.description: Search filter to apply (include or exclude)

internal_list_limit.description: Internal parameter to limit the number of items processed. Not exposed to end-users.

post.description: This endpoint provides aggregated metrics grouped by custom keys for mentions of the keywords or domains specified in the target array of the request

domain.description: Target domain to search for LLM mentions

search_filter.description: Search filter to apply (include or exclude)

search_scope.description: Target search scope for LLM mentions

keyword.description: Target keyword to search for LLM mentions

search_filter.description: Search filter to apply (include or exclude)

search_scope.description: Target search scope for LLM mentions

target.description: array of objects containing target entities. a single target can contain up to 10 domain and/or keyword entities

targets.description: array of objects containing target entities with aggregation keys. you can specify up to 10, but not less than 2

location_name.description: full name of the location, example: 'United Kingdom', 'United States'

platform.description: Platform to search for LLM mentions

filters.description:
you can add several filters at once (8 filters maximum)
   you should set a logical operator and, or between the conditions
   the following operators are supported:
   regex, not_regex, <, <=, >, >=, =, <>, in, not_in, match, not_match, ilike, not_ilike, like, not_like
   you can use the % operator with like and not_like, as well as ilike and not_ilike to match any string of zero or more characters
   merge operator must be a string and connect two other arrays, availible values: or, and.
   example:
["ai_search_volume",">","1000"]
The full list of possible filters is available in 'ai_optimization_llm_mentions_filters' tool

internal_list_limit.description: Internal parameter to limit the number of items processed. Not exposed to end-users.

post.description: This endpoint provides aggregated LLM mentions metrics grouped by the most frequently mentioned domains for the specified target

search_filter.description: Search filter to apply (include or exclude)

target.description: Array of target objects to search for LLM mentions. Each object must contain either 'domain' or 'keyword'. Maximum number of targets: 1000

platform.description: Platform to search for LLM mentions

links_scope.description: specifies which links will be used to extract domains and aggregation

initial_dataset_filters.description:
you can add several filters at once (8 filters maximum)
   you should set a logical operator and, or between the conditions
   the following operators are supported:
   regex, not_regex, <, <=, >, >=, =, <>, in, not_in, match, not_match, ilike, not_ilike, like, not_like
   you can use the % operator with like and not_like, as well as ilike and not_ilike to match any string of zero or more characters
   merge operator must be a string and connect two other arrays, availible values: or, and.
   example:
["ai_search_volume",">","1000"]
The full list of possible filters is available in 'ai_optimization_llm_mentions_filters' tool

items_list_limit.description: maximum number of results in the items array, min value is 1, max value is 10

internal_list_limit.description: maximum number of elements within internal arrays, min value is 1, max value is 10

post.description: Utility tool for kw_data_google_ads_search_volume to get list of availible locations.

country_iso_code.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, for example: US, GB, MT

location_type.description: Type of location. Possible variants: 'TV Region','Postal Code','Neighborhood','Governorate','National Park','Quarter','Canton','Airport','Okrug','Prefecture','City','Country','Province','Barrio','Sub-District','Congressional District','Municipality District','district','DMA Region','Union Territory','Territory','Colloquial Area','Autonomous Community','Borough','County','State','District','City Region','Commune','Region','Department','Division','Sub-Ward','Municipality','University'

location_name.description: Name of location or it`s part.

post.description: Get search volume data for keywords from Google Ads

location_name.description:
full name of the location
required field
Location format - hierarchical, comma-separated (from most specific to least)
 Can be one of:
 1. Country only: "United States"
 2. Region,Country: "California,United States"
 3. City,Region,Country: "San Francisco,California,United States"

language_code.description:
Language two-letter ISO code (e.g., 'en').
optional field

keywords.description: Array of keywords to get search volume for

post.description: This endpoint will provide you with the demographic breakdown (by age and gender) of keyword popularity per each specified term based on DataForSEO Trends data

location_name.description:
full name of the location
        optional field
        in format "Country"
        example:
        United Kingdom

keywords.description:
keywords
        the maximum number of keywords you can specify: 5

date_from.description:
starting date of the time range
          if you don’t specify this field, the current day and month of the preceding year will be used by default
          minimal value for the web type: 2004-01-01
          minimal value for other types: 2008-01-01
          date format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
          example:
          "2019-01-15"

date_to.description:
ending date of the time range
            if you don’t specify this field, the today’s date will be used by default
            date format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
            example:
            "2019-01-15"

time_range.description:
preset time ranges
            if you specify date_from or date_to parameters, this field will be ignored when setting a task

preset time ranges

post.description: This endpoint will provide you with the keyword popularity data from DataForSEO Trends. You can check keyword trends for Google Search, Google News, and Google Shopping

location_name.description:
full name of the location
        optional field

        example:

keywords.description:
keywords

get.description: This endpoint will provide you list of Google Trends Categories

post.description: This endpoint will provide you with the keyword popularity data from the ‘Explore’ feature of Google Trends. You can check keyword trends for Google Search, Google News, Google Images, Google Shopping, and YouTube

location_name.description:
full name of the location
        optional field
        in format "Country"
        example:
        United Kingdom

language_code.description:
Language two-letter ISO code (e.g., 'en').
        optional field

keywords.description:
keywords
        the maximum number of keywords you can specify: 5
        the maximum number of characters you can specify in a keyword: 100
        the minimum number of characters must be greater than 1
        comma characters (,) in the specified keywords will be unset and ignored
        Note: keywords cannot consist of a combination of the following characters: < > |  " - + = ~ ! : * ( ) [ ] { }

        Note: to obtain google_trends_topics_list and google_trends_queries_list items, specify no more than 1 keyword

date_from.description:
starting date of the time range
          if you don’t specify this field, the current day and month of the preceding year will be used by default
          minimal value for the web type: 2004-01-01
          minimal value for other types: 2008-01-01
          date format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
          example:
          "2019-01-15"

date_to.description:
ending date of the time range
            if you don’t specify this field, the today’s date will be used by default
            date format: "yyyy-mm-dd"
            example:
            "2019-01-15"

time_range.description:
preset time ranges
            if you specify date_from or date_to parameters, this field will be ignored when setting a task

item_types.description:
types of items returned
            to speed up the execution of the request, specify one item at a time

category_code.description:
google trends search category
            you can receive the list of available categories with their category_code by making a separate request to the keywords_data_google_trends_categories tool
